name: Bandit
movement: 30 feet walking speed, average pace for tactical positioning
description: A rough, scrappy humanoid wearing mismatched leather armor, often armed with a scimitar and a light crossbow.
memorable: Known for their ability to ambush unsuspecting travelers in groups, capitalizing on their numbers to overwhelm enemies.
goals: Typically motivated by greed, bandits prey on the weak, often engaging in theft and robbery.
relations: Often found in gangs or groups, sometimes led by more powerful individuals like thugs or veterans.
environment: Commonly encountered on remote roads or in small villages where they can ambush their targets.
strengths: Their strength lies in their numbers and ambush tactics rather than individual combat prowess.
weaknesses: Fragile with low hit points, making them vulnerable in direct confrontations.
attacks: Uses melee scimitar attacks for slashing damage and ranged attacks with a light crossbow for piercing damage.
most_powerful_ability: Opportunist, allowing advantage on opportunity attacks when enemies leave their reach.
skills: Average in social interactions and perception with no significant skills.
additional_information: Can perform a bonus action to Steal Item from a nearby target.
Often live outside the law, adopting various moral standpoints.
Sometimes serve as minor antagonists or light adversaries in adventures.
Not all bandits are evil; some may take up banditry out of necessity.
Pirates are considered bandits of the high seas.
